DrmInfoPersistStructure Struct Reference
[Auxiliary]

#include <Apoxi/Auxiliary/DrmInfo.hpp>


Data Fields

UINT16 m_permissions

Detailed Description

DrmInfo is a class to store and manage objects protected by Digital Rights Management. For more information about DRM by OMA (Open Mobile Alliance) please refer to the OMA Digital Rights Management version 1.0 on http://www.openmobilealliance.org/documents.asp

At the moment of this implementation the documents are released in version 1.0

DRM Message Media Types: application/vnd.oma.drm.message = ForwardLock

Overview about the different DrmMethods is provided by Nokia http://www.forum.nokia.com/html_reader/main/1,32611,2563,00.html?page_nbr=2

"The OMA DRM Version 1.0 standard will govern the use of mobile-centric content types, whether they are received by WAP download or Multimedia Message Service (MMS). This will be the world's first mobile DRM standard. The standard provides three DRM methods: forward-lock, combined delivery and separate delivery.

->Forward-lock is intended for the delivery of news, sports, information, and images that should not be forwarded to others. It will be applied most often in subscription-based services. A mobile device is allowed to play, display, or execute, but it cannot forward the media object. The content itself is hidden inside the DRM message that is delivered to the terminal. A DRM message contains a media object and an optional rights object. In the forward-lock method, the DRM message contains only the media object.

->Combined delivery enables usage rules to be set for the media object. This method extends forward-lock by adding a rights object to the DRM Message. Rights define how the device is allowed to render the content. Rights can be limited using both time and count constraints. This method also enables a preview feature. For instance, the rights object for a ring tone distributed inside a DRM Message could specify that the ring tone could be played only twice or only for two weeks.

->Separate delivery protects higher-value media and enables super distribution, which allows the device to forward the media but not the rights. This is achieved by delivering the content and rights via separate channels, which is more secure than a combined delivery method. The content is encrypted into DRM Content Format (DCF) using symmetric encryption, while the rights specify a Content Encryption Key (CEK), which is used by the DRM User Agent in the device for decryption." [(c) by Nokia (http://www.forum.nokia.com/html_reader/main/1,32611,2563,00.html?page_nbr=2)]

This version of the DrmInfo Class implements the ForwardLock only!
